isis.stitle: International® DT 466E, DT 466, 530, 530E, and HT 530 Diesel Engines - Power Cylinders - Clean, Inspect, and Test - Bearing Fit

svcprocinfo.para: About Bearing Crush and SpreadBearing shells must fit tightly in bore. When bearing shells are inserted in connecting rod and cap, they protrude above paring line. This protrusion is required to achieve "Bearing Crush."

Bearing shells are designed with "Spread." That is, width across open ends are slightly larger than diameter of connecting rod bore in which they are assembled. This condition is designed in bearing shell. By inserting crankshaft, it pushes the bearing downward in the bore thus forcing the bearing ends inward.
Some "Snap" may be lost in normal use but bearing replacement is not required because of a nominal loss of "Snap."

calloutgroup.callout1: Outside Diameter of Bearing (same as the diameter of the connecting rod bore when installed)

svcprocinfo.para:
If bearing-to-crankshaft running clearances exceed specifications because of wear on the crankshaft, replace or regrind crankshaft and install under size precision-type bearing shells. See " Install Crankshaft and Main Bearings
" in the "Vibration Damper, Crankshaft, Main Bearings, Flywheel, and Crankcase" section in this manual, for procedure.

note.para: Do not attempt to reduce journal-to-bearing running clearances by reworking bearing cap, bearings, or both. Regrind or replace crankshaft only.

caution.para: To avoid engine damage when servicing, do not mix forged connecting rods with fractured connecting rods in the same engine. Weights of connecting rods are different and will cause engine vibration if mixed.
To avoid engine damage, reworking bearing cap or bearing will destroy engineered fit of bearing shells in their bores.

step1.para: Tighten connecting rod bolts alternately and evenly to " Special Torque ."

note.para: When assembly is drawn up tight, bearing is compressed, ensuring positive contact between bearing back and bore.

calloutgroup.callout1: Diameter (A) at right angles to parting lines is greater than diameter (B).
With bearing cap drawn up tight, diameters (A) and (B) are equal.
Difference between diameters (A) and (B) is Bearing Crush (C).

svcsubproc.title: Measure Connecting Rod Bearing Running Clearance

step1.para: With bearing cap removed, wipe oil from face of bearing insert and exposed portion of crankshaft journal.
Place a piece of Plastigage® across full width of bearing about 6 mm (1/4 in) off center.
Install bearing cap. Tighten bolts evenly and alternately to " Special Torque ."

note.para: Do not turn crankshaft during running clearance check.

step1.para: Remove connecting rod bearing cap. The Plastigage® will be found adhering to either bearing shell or crankshaft. Do not remove Plastigage®. Use Plastigage® scale to measure widest point of flattened plastic material. The number in graduated marks on scale indicates clearance in thousandths of an inch or millimeters.
Completely remove test material (crushed Plastigage® material) and repeat test for each connecting rod bearing.

If bearing-to-crankshaft running clearances exceed " Specifications ," replace or regrind crankshaft and install under size precision-type bearing shells. See " Install Crankshaft and Main Bearings
" in the "Vibration Damper, Crankshaft, Main Bearings, Flywheel, and Crankcase" section in this manual, for procedure.

note.para: Bearing cap torque is very important. Repeat running clearance check procedure before condemning crankshaft.

With precision bearings used, no problem should be encountered. If proper clearance is not achieved, a problem with connecting rod, bearing set, or crankshaft may exist which requires regrinding and use of under size bearings.

step1.para: Measure side clearance between connecting rod and crankshaft journal with Feeler Gauge .

svcsubproc.title: Measure Connecting Rod Side Clearance
svcsubproc.para: Lack of connecting rod side clearance could indicate a damaged rod or a rod bearing out of position. Excessive connecting rod side clearance may require replacement of the rods or crankshaft.

step1.para: Place tip of Dial Indicator on connecting rod cap.
Pry connecting rod cap toward rear of the engine and zero dial indicator.
Pry connecting rod cap toward front of engine. Read Dial Indicator.
Connecting rod side clearance must be in " Specification ." Repeat this procedure for all connecting rods.

note.para: Connecting rod side clearance must be checked to be sure that specified clearance exists.
